Absolutely! Here are some tips for beginners who are exploring hip-hop dance for the first time:

1. Find a good teacher: Having a good teacher who is knowledgeable and experienced in hip-hop dance can make all the difference. They can guide you through the basic movements, provide feedback on your technique, and help you to develop your own individual style.

2. Focus on the fundamentals: While it can be tempting to jump right into advanced moves and routines, it's important to start with the fundamental movements and build from there. Focus on developing a strong foundation of basic footwork movements such as the two-step, body rolls, and shuffles.

3. Practice regularly: Like any other skill, hip-hop dance takes time and practice to master. Set aside time each day or each week to practice your footwork and other movements. Be patient with yourself and remember that progress takes time.

4. Watch and learn from other dancers: Watch videos of other hip-hop dancers and pay attention to their footwork and movements. This can help you to develop a more diverse and nuanced understanding of the style, and inspire you to try out new moves and techniques.

5. Have fun: Hip-hop dance is all about expressing yourself and having fun through movement. Don't take yourself too seriously or get too caught up in trying to perfect your footwork. Enjoy the process and let your body move freely.

With these tips in mind, you should feel more prepared and confident to start exploring hip-hop dance and footwork, even if you're not a fan of hip-hop music. Remember to take it one step at a time, be patient with yourself, and most importantly, have fun!
